intro: Proclesia warscewiczii, commonly known as the Warscewicz's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in botanical collections.
